summary: This is an email chain from December 9, 2018, discussing the status of the Jeffrey Epstein case. It references a comprehensive collection of investigative materials, including media reports, books, civil case filings, FBI 302s, and primary source documents like the 'black book' and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). An attached spreadsheet organizes information on witnesses, accusers, attorneys, and a case chronology.

persons.name: James Patterson
persons.context: Mentioned as the author of one of two books on the Epstein investigation and underlying conduct.

events.title: Media Coverage of Epstein Case
events.description: Dozens of media reports dating back to the early 2000s and continuing through December 2018 about the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Case Status Update Compilation
events.description: An email is sent compiling extensive materials on the Epstein case, including books, civil filings, FBI 302s, and primary documents like the 'black book' and NPA.

keyFacts: The document references an extensive collection of Epstein case materials compiled as of December 2018, including over 500 pages of FBI 302s.
Primary source documents mentioned include Epstein's 'black book' and the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
An attached spreadsheet organizes key case information into tabs for witnesses, accusers/victims, attorneys, civil cases, law enforcement, a chronology, and press articles.
Two books on the investigation are noted: one by author James Patterson and one by an independent investigator.
The email appears to be official correspondence, with the sender's signature identifying them as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
